```{r setup}
library(testthat)
library(jeksterslabRboot)
context("Test alphaplot.")
```


## Alpha Level

### Two-Tailed


```{r }
alpha2plot(
  alpha = 0.05,
  dist = "z",
  statistic = 3
)
alpha2plot(
  alpha = 0.05,
  dist = "t",
  df = 5
)
```


### One-Tailed


```{r }
alpha2plot(
  alpha = 0.05,
  two.tailed = FALSE,
  right.tail = TRUE
)
alpha2plot(
  alpha = 0.05,
  two.tailed = FALSE,
  right.tail = FALSE
)
alpha2plot(
  alpha = 0.05,
  dist = "t",
  two.tailed = FALSE,
  right.tail = TRUE,
  df = 5
)
alpha2plot(
  alpha = 0.05,
  dist = "t",
  two.tailed = FALSE,
  right.tail = FALSE,
  df = 5
)
alpha2plot(
  alpha = 0.05,
  dist = "F",
  df1 = 10,
  df2 = 3
)
alpha2plot(
  alpha = 0.05,
  dist = "chisq",
  df = 3
)
```


## Confidence Interval

### Two-Tailed


```{r }
alpha2plot(
  alpha = 0.05,
  ci = TRUE,
  dist = "z",
  statistic = 3
)
alpha2plot(
  alpha = 0.05,
  ci = TRUE,
  dist = "t",
  df = 5
)
```


### One-Tailed


```{r }
alpha2plot(
  alpha = 0.05,
  ci = TRUE,
  two.tailed = FALSE,
  right.tail = TRUE
)
alpha2plot(
  alpha = 0.05,
  ci = TRUE,
  two.tailed = FALSE,
  right.tail = FALSE
)
alpha2plot(
  alpha = 0.05,
  ci = TRUE,
  dist = "t",
  two.tailed = FALSE,
  right.tail = TRUE,
  df = 5
)
alpha2plot(
  alpha = 0.05,
  ci = TRUE,
  dist = "t",
  two.tailed = FALSE,
  right.tail = FALSE,
  df = 5
)
alpha2plot(
  alpha = 0.05,
  ci = TRUE,
  dist = "F",
  df1 = 10,
  df2 = 3
)
alpha2plot(
  alpha = 0.05,
  ci = TRUE,
  dist = "chisq",
  df = 3
)
```
